intro: Brachystegia bakeriana, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and yellow flowers. The tree typically grows in dry woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in regions with seasonal rainfall. Its bark is thick and often fissured, providing protection against fire and insect damage. Brachystegia bakeriana plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining soil stability.
